section.p: Implemented on product1.html, product2.html and product3.html. An enquiry icon is added beside the price of every product. It functions as a button that redirects the user to the enquiry page which allows users to make enquiry when needed. When the user clicks on the enquiry icon, a session object will be created with a key of ‘Model’ to store the data related to the product model. This session object is required to fill the subject input automatically when the user is redirected to the enquiry page.

section.h2: Fill Subject Input based on Product Selected
section.p: For enquiry page, when the user selects the product in the product input field, the subject input field will be filled automatically based on the product selected by the user. The value of session storage with the key 'Model' is obtained to fill the product input field.

Implemented on product1.html, product2.html and product3.html. A list of product items is kept in script.js and are used to populate the 3 pages listed above on load. Each page has a popup layout near the end on the markup that will be updated by the script whenever a product is being clicked.

section.h2: Red Border When Invalid Form Input
section.p: This is implemented on enquiry page. The form inputs in enquiry are validated when the submit button is clicked. When there are invalid inputs, an alert message would pop out and all the invalid input fields will have a red border around it. If the user submits another time with the correct input, the red border will not be shown anymore.
Implemented on product1.html, product2.html and product3.html. The product data exist in shared.js and is used to programmatically create the DOM nodes for each product.
